result.execSummary:
The defendant Andrew J Maki was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Arm Self w/ Dangerous Weapon, a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(2)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with any sentence defendant is now serving.

superMiscConds.notes:
Pay all court costs, fees, and surcharges. If the defendant is discharged from Extended Supervision with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment may be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.
DOC COLLECT 
--------------------

No weapons. No firearms. No ammunition.
--------------------

No possession or consumption of alcohol. Not to enter into any bars, taverns, or liquor stores. No possession or consumption of drugs or drug paraphernalia. No contact with the victim. 
--------------------

Maintain full-time employment, schooling, or combination of both.
--------------------
Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge. Complete all programming as deemed appropriate by the Agent.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Andrew J Maki

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing before the Honorable Phillip Koss on August 5, 2022
Court Reporter Sandy Elderbrook

9:00am Court in session

Defendant Andrew Maki present in court, in custody via video from Fox Lake Correctional with attorney Jeramiah Maynard. James Sempf appears for the State of Wisconsin. 

Matter before the Court is set for sentencing.
PSI Received & Reviewed by the parties.
No material corrections to be made by the parties.
State is in compliance with victims rights.
Parties have an agreement, Atty Maynard puts agreement

Deft makes statement to the Court

Court makes record & sentences Deft:

10 years WSP, bifurcated
5 years IC
5 years ES
concurrent to Deft's current sentence

Conditions of extended supervision to include:

Payment of all costs, fees & surcharges
DNA Sample & Surcharge
No possession or consumption of any alcohol
Not to enter into any bars, taverns or liquor stores.
No possession or consumption of drugs or drug paraphernalia
Maintain full-time employment, schooling or combination of both
No contact with victim.
No weapons. No firearms. No ammunition.
Complete all programming as deemed appropriate by the agent


9:04am Court in recess
Case will remain assigned to Judge Koss after August 1, 2022.
Plaintiff's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor

records.addlTxt: Notice of Motion and Motion for Establishment of Discovery Deadlines.
records.descr: Notice of motion and motion for discovery

records.addlTxt:
10:06am Court in session

Defendant Andrew Maki present in court, in custody via video with attorney Jeramiah Maynard. James Sempf appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Matter was set for final pretrial but parties have an agreement, Atty Maynard places agreement on the record. 

State will cap recommendation of initial confinement at 5 years.
State is in compliance with victims rights, there are no victims present. 

Plea questionnaire e-filed by Defense.
Court has plea colloquy with Deft. 
Court reminds Deft of maximum penalties, Deft acknowledges. 
Court gives warnings as to deportation, voting ineligibility & firearm restriction, Deft acknowledges. 

Court notes that an information was never filed. State makes record that information will mirror complaint. 
Deft pleads guilty to Ct #1

Court finds factual basis exists, adjudges Deft guilty, orders PSI & sets sentencing date

Deft currently serving prison sentence & asking that sentencing be via video. 
Court will set up video for sentencing hearing.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 5, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Scheduling Order will be provided to Attys via e-filing by the Court
Not guilty plea entered and trial reserved.

Prosecuting attorney J J. Crawford appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Andrew J Maki appeared in court, in custody by video. Attorney jeramiah maynard for Andrew J Maki appeared in court. Not guilty plea entered and trial reserved. Matter was scheduled for a preliminary hearing but the defendant wishes to waive his right to a preliminary hearing.  Response by Counsel and defendant to Court's questions.  Court finds defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily waives his right to a preliminary hearing and binds the defendant over. Attorney Maynard appointed yesterday and met with defendant this morning. Court has prelim waiver colloquy with defendant. Defendant wishes to waive his preliminary hearing. Defendant requested speedy disposition through detainer. Trial to be heard by June 17, 2022. State is not sure if information will mirror complaint but defense wishes to proceed with arraignment. Court will reserve defendant's right to object if charges do not match. Motion deadline will be April 29, 2022. If defendant goes back to prison, defendant can appear via video. Attorney Maynard to contact Court. Minutes filed.
Final pre-trial scheduled for June 2, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for June 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Prosecuting attorney James T. Sempf appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Andrew J Maki not in court, Attorney Obi Uzowulu appeared for jeramiah maynard for Andrew J Maki in court. State is requesting that this matter be set for trial under strict time lines. Prompt disposition, 120 days. Minutes filed.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 15, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

Prosecuting attorney J J. Crawford appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Andrew J Maki appeared in court, in custody by video with Attorney Mackenzie Renner. Defendant does qualify for SPD attorney. Court inquired if victim wished to be heard; no statement made. Court does not set bond at this time. Defendant in prison for 12 more years. Defendant has requested prompt disposition. Court extends WRIT to Monday. Minutes filed.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 14, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Original Warrant filed with the court.
